bestBHT.bht: Take heed, for the Lord has foretold all things. Just as lightning shines from east to west, so too will the coming of the Son of Man be. Gullibility is not a mark of saintliness or piety; rather, God has given us our wits for self-protection. Remember His warning, for it is proof of His omniscience. Remain on guard against deception and temptation, using all means available to persevere until the end.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: But take ye heed; behold, I have foretold you all things."
He bids them be on their guard, as the proper means of averting that catastrophe.
For as the lightning cometh out of the east, and shineth even unto the west; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.
Archibald T. Robertson: Gullibility is no mark of a saint or of piety.
Credulity ranks no higher than scepticism.
God gave us our wits for self-protection.
John Gill: But take ye heed...to make use of all means for their perseverance."
It becomes them to be on their guard against every deception, and temptation."
Moreover, when all these should be accomplished, they would remember that he had told them of them beforehand; which would be a proof of his omniscience.

bhtAttempts.bht: Be on guard and heed this warning, for the Lord Himself has foretold everything. Just as lightning flashes across the sky in a sweeping display, so too will the Son of Man come in His glorious return. Do not be easily deceived or gullible, for the Lord has given us our faculties of reason and discernment for our own protection. Remember His words, for they are proof of His omniscience and a call for us to persevere in the face of deception and temptation.

Take heed, for the Lord has foretold all things. Just as lightning illuminates the sky from east to west, so too will the Son of Man appear in His coming. It is essential for believers to exercise caution, avoiding both gullibility and skepticism. The Lord has bestowed upon us the gift of reason for our own protection. Let us remember His words, a sign of His omniscience, and remain vigilant against deception and temptation, persevering until the end.

Be cautious and alert, for the Lord has warned and revealed all. The Son of Man's return will be as evident as lightning flashing across the sky from east to west. It is important not to be easily deceived or gullible, as true piety requires discernment. God has given us our wits for self-protection, enabling us to navigate through the trials and temptations of this world. Remember that the Lord's foreknowledge is displayed in His prior revelation, compelling us to remain steadfast and vigilant.

Take heed, for the Lord has foretold all things. Just as lightning shines from east to west, so too will the coming of the Son of Man be. Gullibility is not a mark of saintliness or piety; rather, God has given us our wits for self-protection. Remember His warning, for it is proof of His omniscience. Remain on guard against deception and temptation, using all means available to persevere until the end.

Be on guard, for the Lord has warned and foretold everything. As surely as lightning illuminates the sky from east to west, the coming of the Son of Man will be witnessed by all. It is crucial that believers exercise discernment and not be easily deceived, as gullibility holds no value in matters of faith. Remember, God has graced us with the gift of intellect to safeguard ourselves. Let us remain vigilant against deception and temptation, as His prior revelation attests to His all-knowing nature.
